results.title: And so they grow
results.creator_credit: Nat Campus and Campus Film Productions
results.brief_description: A real life story of a group of nine-year-old children. While the program does not make an issue of, or mention race, it shows children of many races growing up together and being enriched by the experience. In addition to the race relationship significance, the program also addresses the importance of good leadership in a play programme and the value of realistic play.

results.title: And one was gold
results.brief_description: Shows the training of a selected puppy as a guide dog, the work of the National Guide Dog Training Centre and the freedom and security made possible to blind people by their dogs.

results.title: And now Miguel
results.creator_credit: Joseph Krumgold and United States Information Agency
results.brief_description: A portrait of an American family to whom the tradition of sheep raising has come down through generations of Spanish ancestors. It is the story of family unity, and of young Miguel and the fulfillment of his dream of being accepted on an equal footing by his father and brothers.

results.title: And how do you feel at the end of the week?
results.creator_credit: Kara Feldman, John Filmer-Mason, Filmedia (Australia) and Productivity Promotion Council of Australia
results.brief_description: Billy works in a factory and is dissatisfied with his job. His girlfriend works in a shop and has remedied the deficiencies in her work situation to make her job challenging and meaningful. Shows the relationship between job satisfaction and performance and how employees and management can communicate to create a more productive work environment.

results.title: ....And everything nice
results.creator_credit: Norma Adams and Columbia Broadcasting System
results.brief_description: Through the process of consciousness raising, women develop new expectations for themselves and a sense of self-worth. The process is marked by an understanding of the ways in which society teaches women to assume passive roles in directing their own lives. In asserting themselves for the first time, many women experience fears and conflicts about the future of women as members of society.

results.title: The Ancient world: Egypt
results.creator_credit: Ray Garner, American Research Center, Egypt and Archaelogical Institute of America
results.brief_description: The story of Egypt from the prehistoric period to the time of the Ptolemies. The beginnings of monumental art are shown at Sakkara, the funeral temple and the step pyramid. The glories of the Old Kingdom, the Pyramids, the Sphinx at Giza, and the artistry of the Middle Kingdom are illustrated in detail. Creations of the great Pharoahs are presented; the temples of Karnak and Luxor, the Colossi of Abu Simbel, and the treasures of the city of Akhenaten and the tomb of Tutankhamen. Scenes painted on temple walls showing the life of the ancient Egyptians are included.

results.title: Ancient Rome
results.brief_description: As a city, religious centre, and capital of an empire, Ancient Rome dominated the people of its times. The achievements of Rome in government, architecture, engineering, and law are summarized, and our own inheritances from Roman culture established.
results.description: As a city, religious centre, and capital of an empire, Ancient Rome dominated the people of its times. The achievements of Rome in government, architecture, engineering, and law are summarized, and our own inheritances from Roman culture established.

results.title: Ancient Persia
results.brief_description: Magnificent ruins now reveal the history of the great Empire of Cyprus and Darius, the splendid palaces of Persepolis, great roads, and gold coinage. Famous sites like Marathan, Hellespont, Thermopylae, and the Bay of Salamis, indicate the shift of power to the Greeks, and the end of the Persian domination.

results.title: Ancient Paestum : city of the Greeks and Romans
results.brief_description: In the ancient city of Paestum, in southern Italy, archaeologists have discovered remnants of a civilization founded by the Greeks in the 6th century B.C. and later dominated by the Romans. Shows the plan of the city and its buildings, many in the finest Doric tradition and in an excellent state of preservation. As well as the sculpture and ceramic work, artifacts and other relics of an ancient Greek and Roman culture.

results.title: The Ancient Orient: the Far East
results.brief_description: Shows the relics of early civilizations in India, China, and Japan. From these relics archaeologists have worked out the patterns of culture of these log-buried civilizations. Ceramics, jade carvings, paintings, sculptures and works of architecture are displayed. Gives an insight into the Eastern religions and philosophies which in varying degrees have influenced western life and thought.
